At Tue, 14 Jul 2009 09:14:24 -0000,
goblin_cz wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I've been crawling for two days selective crawl with 300 toe threds. After this time heritrix unexpectedly crash with this message in heritrix_out.log
>
> #
> # An unexpected error has been detected by Java Runtime Environment:
> #
> #  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00002aaaab4c4200, pid=18147, tid=1087596896
> #
> # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (11.0-b15 mixed mode linux-amd64)
> # Problematic frame:
> # v  ~BufferBlob::jni_fast_GetIntField
> #
> # An error report file with more information is saved as:
> # /mnt/pole-b/heritrix/hs_err_pid18147.log
> #
> # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
> #   http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp
> # The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code.
> # See problematic frame for where to report the bug.
>
> I am using
> heritrix 1.14.2
> java 64b - 1.6.0_10
> debian
>
> How can I avoid this type of error? This one wasn't so critical as it can be in large crawl because I intend to end this crawl soon.

See: <http://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1126>

Your java version is somewhat out of date, it seems that upgrading to
1.6.0_14 should fix the problem.

> Second thing I have on my mind. Can I just rename arc.gz.open files to arc.gz and use it for indexing?

Yes, you should be able to. We do that here at the California Digital
Library without difficulties.

best,
Erik Hetzner

PS: We have just launched our public access site, http://webarchives.cdlib.org/

Many thanks to IA for your hard work & fine tools.
